drug.name: 99mTc-glucarate
drug.description: 99mTc-glucarate(GLA) is an agent for non-invasive detection of breast tumours.

article.citation: Liu Z, Stevenson GD, Barrett HH, Kastis GA, Bettan M, Furenlid LR, Wilson DW, Woolfenden JM, Pak KY: 99mTc glucarate high-resolution imaging of drug sensitive and drug resistant human breast cancer xenografts in SCID mice. Nucl Med Commun. 2004 Jul;25(7):711-20.
Okada DR, Johnson G, Liu Z, Hocherman SD, Khaw BA, Okada RD: Early detection of infarct in reperfused canine myocardium using 99mTc-glucarate. J Nucl Med. 2004 Apr;45(4):655-64.

drug.indication: Investigated for use/treatment in myocardial infarction.
drug.mechanism-of-action: 99m Tc-Glucarate marks acute myocardial infarct very early after occlusion and appears to accurately assess infarct size when compared with triphenyltetrazolium chloride (TTC) staining.
